  • Classes in com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph used by com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph
    Class
    Description
    Digraph
    A directed graph (or digraph) is a graph that is made up of a set of vertices connected by edges, where the edges have a direction associated with them.
    DigraphEdgeList
    Implementation of a digraph that adheres to the Digraph interface.
    Edge
    An edge connects two Vertex of type V and stores an element of type E.
    Graph
    A graph is made up of a set of vertices connected by edges, where the edges have no direction associated with them, i.e., they establish a two-way connection.
    InvalidEdgeException
    Thrown when using an invalid edge in calls of methods in Graph and Digraph implementations.
    InvalidVertexException
    Thrown when using an invalid vertex in calls of methods in Graph and Digraph implementations.
    Vertex
    A vertex contains an element of type V and is used both in graphs and digraphs.
